website_summaries.verdict: An economical choice that's easy to fold up and store – however, it's only intended for artificial trees.
pros: Folding legs make it easy to store during the off-season
Thumb screw attaches stand to tree pole
cons: Not intended for real Christmas trees

customer_reviews.title: Saved Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: This saved our butt. Had an artificial tree and lost the stand. Went to Target, Walmart, everywhere and couldn't find a stand for a 9 foot tree. We bought this in hopes it would fit our 1 and 1/4 inch tree. We opened the box and were terrified. The stand had a 2 inch hole! BUT luckily they thought of that. There is an insert that you place inside the 2 inch hole to make it fit a 1 and 1/4 inch tree. PERFECT! We purchased the 32A-Inch version. This version fits a 2 inch or 1 and 1/4 inch tree.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a 7-foot vintage aluminum Christmas that was missing its stand, so I bought this hoping it would do the trick. I was pleased that it not only fit the tree perfectly, it is also much sturdier and higher quality than the plastic tree stands that come with most artificial trees. I may eventually spray paint this to match my silver tree, but the tree skirt I have covers it nicely. My cat also enjoys sleeping under the tree and using this thing as a chin rest, so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as advertised. Will require adjustments.
customer_reviews.text: It seems good quality, but does not work for my tree, despite being advertised for my size tree. The screw is not long enough to put pressure on the fake tree “trunk”, so it leans in the stand. Also, there is no bottom on the stand/trunk hole, just a tube, so the metal “trunk” of my tree goes right through and sits on my floor. I have wood floors, so it scratches the floor unless I put something under it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this stand as it's adjustable to different tree sizes ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a "hand-me-down" tree from a friend that didn't come with a stand. I would highly recommend this stand as it's adjustable to different tree sizes and with the large metal base is very sturdy. I thought the tree I had was 9' tall but after setting it up turns out it was actually an 8' tree, so the stand works for trees smaller than the listed size, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. It was so light and flimsy I'm not sure how this can hold anyone's tree?? I have a tree, says it's 6 feet but I'm almost 5'10 and am taller than it. Anyway, I lost the stand and the brand doesn't sell replacements. I read reviews and the description for this carefully, it says it's adjustable. Mine base is just under 1.25in and there is no way this thing could hold up my tree. Even if my base was 1.25in this stand is so light there is no way it would work. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: volvomom

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKED!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!! I bought a 9ft tree at the AtHome store 2 years ago ($400). When I moved this year, the stand went missing. Zero help from the AtHome store on a replacement so I thankfully found this one. Our tree bottom is 2in and has slits in the metal. Trying to find a stand that would fit was HARD!!! I am so over the moon happy that this one worked!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emashburn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tree stand!
customer_reviews.text: After using the same Christmas tree stand for almost 15 years, it finally gave out. As I searched local stores for another one, I discovered that finding an artificial tree stand was more difficult than I expected! After going several places I came across this one on Amazone - and it is perfect! Our tree is large and bulky, but this stand more than does the job of keeping it upright. I highly recommend the National Tree stand - in whatever size - you need. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Tree stand to the rescue!
customer_reviews.text: While setting up my mom's artificial 7' tree this year, I quickly determined that the flimsy stand has completely busted (after only 4 years). There was no way to repair it, so I hopped on Amazon hoping for some kind of generic alternative. I took a risk with this stand, but once we received it two days later, it worked perfectly... and it's a hundred time more sturdy and easier to use than the one that broke. Christmas crisis averted!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good stand but has a flaw
customer_reviews.text: It's s good design but has its flaws. I set it up and inserted the adapter for my tree. Our tree leaned and the adapter bent and popped outn of the tube. The issue is its not made out of durable material. It's cheap thin plastic. It pulled right through where the set screw inserts. There is nothing to hold the tree at the bottom only at the top. It goes through to the floor which makes it unstable. The rest of the stand is well made. Folding is a great feature. It also has sturdy legs.
customer_reviews.author: 68goat

customer_reviews.title: STURDY, EASY-TO-USE, FOLDS FOR EASY STORAGE
customer_reviews.text: The plastic stand that came with our 7.5 foot artificial tree broke after years of use. Not wanting to toss out our beautiful Christmas tree, we tried to find a sturdier replacement made specifically for artificial trees. Having no success, we came across this one which is made for live trees - but decided to give it a try anyway. This worked out perfectly for our artificial tree - even if it is not being sold for that purpose. It is sturdy, holds the tree well, and folds up nicely for easy storage. Obviously I cannot guarantee that it will work for your artificial tree, but it has worked well for ours.
customer_reviews.author: Hanging in there

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! The stand does not fit 1 inch pole!!!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with the tree stand. It's just that it doesn't fit with our tree, which has a 1 inch pole. The only bolt that comes with it theoretically would fix the problem, but actually it does not work! The tree is too heavy, with only one bolt instead of three, it cannot stop the tree from wobbling. Did call the customer service, no fix, has to return it!
customer_reviews.author: AprilZJ

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived without a shipping box in a product box that was torn and retaped. The base itself is also very poor quality and doesn't hold together. A terrible product. I am stuck with it because Christmas is around the corner but I am more than annoyed at its condition.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: National Tree should include all adaptors in every package.
customer_reviews.text: Below is the description given on the website. ----> <------- These symbols point out how the company lied. Adaptors were not included in our package. Our Christmas season is off to a deplorable start b/c National Tree failed on quality assurance and the inclusion of hardware needed for their product. Now, I have to wait for another product to be delivered and make a return. _________________________________________________________________________________________ For use with 9 ft. To 12 ft. Tall artificial trees with 1.25to 2Diameter center poles -------->Includes separate adaptor for use with 1.25Diameter poles<-------------- Legs Fold flat for storage Sturdy steel construction Thumb screw included
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not Secure At All!
customer_reviews.text: States for tree with pole 1.25 inches. Measured diameter of my tree pole is 1.25 inches. Our tree is 6 feet. Only comes with one pin and will not tighten enough to securely hold the tree. The pin is too short and with just one pin the tree is wobbly. Even wobbly with cardboard pieces. Would be better if there were 2 or 3 pins for stability. Returning this item
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is not really adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Try a different model. It does not come with O rings so you can fit most trees. The screw is too short so it doesn't touch the pole and so I had to shove crap in there. Plus, the pole goes straight through to the ground which means the floors can be scratched. Bad model.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Hans

customer_reviews.title: Yippee! Stability. Easy and quick.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! It came folded flat in the box, just slide it out and pop it open, line it up and drop tree in. Nice and wide to give stability. Yes, I did have concerns when reading about the flimsy box it would be shipped in. True, the box is flimsy but the metal stand is nice and thick, box looks a mess from getting trampled when shipped. Be on the lookout for the lone screw that is loose in the box. My tree fits so nicely in the long tube I didn't need to tighten down the screw. I am going to enjoy for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: DebraJ

customer_reviews.title: Tree stand for Dummies
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to put two pieces of anything together, but this tree stand was by far the easiest connection I've ever had. The stand seems like it's not very sturdy, but putting it together, it held my tree steady and was, in fact, the sturdiest tree stand I've ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Bratty Ann

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Buzz Kill.
customer_reviews.text: Straight up buzz kill. Won’t stay tight enough on the trunk to keep it from falling through to the bottom (which makes it tip over). Was supposed to come with adjustable pieces for different size trunks. Doesn’t. We’re going out this evening to find a new one at Fred Meyer so our fully decorated tree doesn’t fall over. (It was up for an hour then fell).
customer_reviews.author: Sean Gasperetti

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold the tree straight.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this tree stand on 12/16 with 2-day shipping. Shipping was a nightmare and we got it 6 days later. We put up the 12 ft. tree and it will not support the tree with just one screw. We have tried everything, including supporting it to the wall. Usually, we have 18-20 foot real trees and have never had a problem as we are having. If this tree stand was stable it should be able to hold the tree straight as it is not as heavy as a real tree. Also, the adapters for sizing were missing from the box. This has ruined our Christmas as now we will not have a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tree stand for an artificial tree
customer_reviews.text: Great tree stand. I had to return it because my kids’ little artificial tree that I bought it for already had a base as part of the actual tree so we didn’t need it. I would recommend it to others for a small artificial tree though for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 3 (BOYS!)

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't hold up a 6.5 ft tree
customer_reviews.text: Item is extremely flimsy. It could not support the weight of my 6.5 ft tree. I had to make alterations to the base to make it stable enough to keep the tree up and it's still barely holding tight. The slightest touch could easily send it crashing down. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J V

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit for my fake tree!
customer_reviews.text: I had a fake tree given to me for free, but didn't realize there was no stand for it. I have never owned a fake christmas tree, so I wasn't sure how to even go about getting a stand for one! I looked this one up and ordered based on size of my tree and fits perfect. easy to use and sturdy. so far we have had it up for a month and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this stand. To begin with it arrived in its original box and looked like it had survived several wars, That in itself was bad enough but one end was poking thru the side of the box, both ends of the box were ripped and taped. The stand itself only has one knob to screw into the pole of the tree causing the tree to move to one side and be crooked. I am very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I almost returned this
customer_reviews.text: The tree fell right over and I thought it didn't work until my father wrapped the base of the tree in sheet metal. Once the tree was tight in the base it stopped falling over. The tree just needs to be tight and not have any wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: L M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold a tree, if the stem is smaller
customer_reviews.text: I need a replacement stand for my 6ft Christmas tree. When I received this stand it looked like was already used and returned. The screw doesn’t hold tied. Not sure if is missing some part of it. I couldn’t return it, because my son was so excited putting up the tree. Now every other day I have to tied the screw because is getting loose on its on and the tree stays slanted.
customer_reviews.author: yuliana m.

customer_reviews.title: Own several!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to keep my Halloween (people/ghouls???) upright instead of depending on trees. One can use any size to work such as a old mop handle or dowel. Adjustable for width. Holds up against the greatest of gust of wind which often happens here. I stake the legs down with tent stakes. Still working after many years. I especially love that this well made device folds flat for storage. I strongly recommend this purchase to all reading here.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Saved Christmas!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 foot tree that I lost the stand for. I have no idea where I packed it away last year. I went to several home improvement centers for a replacement and no luck at all finding a stand for an artificial tree over 7 feet. I was ready to give up having a tree this year, then I found this on Amazon. I ordered it on Monday and received it that Wednesday. With the insert that came with the 36 inch stand, the pole fit perfectly and the tree is sturdy, more so than it had been with my old stand. I am very pleased! Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at the end of last season. At the time the description indicated it fit 1.25-2 inch pole diameters. The box also indicates the same thing. Unfortunately when I went to put up my tree this year, it’s clear that it can only accommodate 1.25 or 2 inch poles. Very disappointing based on the product description and box.
customer_reviews.author: djcar99

customer_reviews.title: they continued playing in the tree and shaking it much more than I liked, but it was stable and we didn't have ...
customer_reviews.text: This saved our Christmas...two young cats had tipped our tree and broke the original stand. Once this one was installed, they continued playing in the tree and shaking it much more than I liked, but it was stable and we didn't have to worry about the tree falling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No bottom on the tube and only ONE screw on the side.
customer_reviews.text: Part of the problem is there is only one screw at the top of the tube to hold the tree. If your tree 'trunk' is smaller in diameter than the hole through the stand, the tree leans to one side. The other problem is there is no bottom on the tube. This causes the weight of the tree to slip through the tube to the floor. We decided this would cause the tree to fall over. We decided these are pretty much useless except for a very short tree. The tube needs to have a solid bottom in it, and a screw added near the bottom on the same side as the supplied one.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Simpkins

customer_reviews.title: Well made! Sturdy! Easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace an old stand that lasted over 20 years. So right off the bat it was up for a difficult comparison. We are very happy with the quality and price of the stand. Easy set up and very sturdy. We are using it for a 7.5 foot tree which is much heavier than the current artifical trees out there today. Needless to say we are very pleased with our purchase. We highly recommend it. You will not be dissapointed. We did not have any hardware issues. Everything was included and fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa582

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT STAND FOR 1.25 INCH TREE TRUNK DIAMETER
customer_reviews.text: If your artificial Christmas tree trunk is 1.25 inches in diameter, then this will work perfectly. It is very sturdy and stable and the adjusting screws allow you to straighten the "tree trunk" and tighten the screws down on it. I am impressed with this unit and wonder why I didn't buy a good stand like this when I bought my current artificial Christmas tree a few years ago and suffered along with the flimsy and stupid stand that came with the tree.
customer_reviews.author: R. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a decent stand for an artificial tree. Happy with this one. It’s heavy and sturdy and worked perfectly this season. Has different inserts to fist different pole sizes. I wish I would have bought it years ago
customer_reviews.author: Dan N.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: Loved the stand, it was big enough to hold our large tree with lots of ornaments. It appeared to be very sturdy, just what I was looking for. My only reason for returning, it was supposed to have a collar which could be used for a tree with a smaller diameter trunk. The adjuster was missing, and after repeated calls to the company customer service department, I was never able to get through. I loved the stand and would like to order it again, but am wondering if that same piece would be missing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Petrulis

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I lost the tree stand for my Balsam christmas tree ... this is a perfect replacement at a fraction of the cost. Easy to use ready to go out of the box. And very sturdy. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great for diameter up to 1 1/4” Max for the size 32A-inch item!
customer_reviews.text: The data for the size 32A-inch states for 1.25” or 2” diameter center poles. The max that I measured without the plastic grommet was 1 5/16”. Don’t know where the 2” data came from. Should be deleted. Otherwise, 1.25” is accurate and everything else is great. For people that don’t know the size 1.25” means then go by 1 1/4”. Please don’t buy this particular item if you need a 2 inch diameter opening. They have others that have a 2 inch opening.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful tree, it was about to be scrapped because ...
customer_reviews.text: So what do you do when you unbox last years tree only to discover that the stand is missing? Get on Amazon of course to search for a replacement. We have a 7 1/2 tree purchased from Hobby Lobby a couple of years ago. A beautiful tree, it was about to be scrapped because somehow we lost the base stand. This replacement stand is superior to the original, slightly bigger and more sturdy. The main pole of our tree is 1 1/4 inches and it fits perfectly. Buy with confidence. Excellent product and saved the day for us.
customer_reviews.author: The Pen

customer_reviews.title: I need to return this
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. The tree stump went right through to the floor and damaged my wood floor. The hole seems larger at the bottom of the cylinder instead of smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Madeln D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: We lost our tree stand (couln’t believe we didn’t store it in the box with the tree). We found this one on Amazon, it arrived quickly and is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: becky sharp

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, out of box ready to go!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old set this up by herself. Quick 2 mins unfolded and done. We lost our stand when we move and thankfully this worked amazing! I was so afraid that our beautiful heavy tree would break it. This stand was better than what originally came with the tree. So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful plant stand, at an excellent price. It's not the prettiest, but that's why you have tree skirts! I'm very happy with it. It kept my tree straight and sturdy. It did the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Ward

customer_reviews.title: Fit issues
customer_reviews.text: The screw that holds it in place doesn't go in far enough for my 7.5' tree so it is currently leaning until I can find a new stand that will work. This would be alot better if it had better stability inside the stand to hold it up and in place super easy to assemble and use it just doesnt hold the tree up at all. I read the specs on this and they all are in line with the size of my tree but it doesnt work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for LARGE artificial trees
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second hand tree with no stand and was worried to find one to accommodate a 10 ft tree! No stores locally had anything large enough. Thank you Amazon for sticking this sized stand. It’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Twinmommydiva

customer_reviews.title: It was really hard to find a stand for my old tree's skinny "trunk"
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the screw with a longer one to hold my tree in place, but once I did, this stand is much better than others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: 100 Watt Walrus

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was going back and forth on which one to order. Our tree suits 6 ft but we went with the stand for 6.5 foot and up. So glad we did it fit perfectly. Very easy to use. Unfolds and 1 part to twist to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Annie

customer_reviews.title: No, don't buy this, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: They sent this with a ridiculous butterfly screw so small in length it didn't even reach the tree! It was less than an inch long! And, only ONE hole...really? How much would it have taken this company to include 2 holes and a longer screw. Amazing. It took 3 hours and the tree is standing but wobbly. I had my gardener drill more holes and purchase more screws. It cost me 45.00 for his work so this was a very EXPENSIVE and very CHEAPLY made stand.
customer_reviews.author: Stardiviner

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Product seems sturdy, although I haven't had a chance to use it. Small rubber caps on the feet fall off, and may not survive long. The first one I received came without the bolt to hold the tree, but they sent me a whole new one after I called to request the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Bp

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 1/2 ft tree product hole was much too big as tree pole went down to the floor which made the stand very unsteady. I am returning product.
customer_reviews.author: QnsPrinc

customer_reviews.title: Will work on 1.5" tree with some effort
customer_reviews.text: I have a tree with a 1 1/2" pole. Looked everywhere but no luck. While this tree stand is designed for either a 11/4" or a 2" pole, it can easily be adapted for 11/2". I just cut a 5" length of 2" PVC, then cut 2 1" widths of shim. Holds a 9 ft tree steady and secure. A little more effort than just assembling but this stand does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Bobtier

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: This was much better than the plastic stand that came with my artificial Christmas tree (which broke). I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: There was only one short keyhole to adjust the tree which makes it lean. Need to drill more holes and buy longer keyholes. Useless product!
customer_reviews.author: teresamorse

customer_reviews.title: Metallic is cheap
customer_reviews.text: Stability not so great, because metallic is cheap. Hope it will hold for the next year . This year I tried just 1week
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: STURDY and SAFE for the Little Ones!
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST buy if you are looking for a Christmas tree stand! We used to own a plastic tree holder and our little one would always go near the Christmas tree that it would scare my husband & I. We finally switched to this and couldn’t be more happier. Very sturdy and we don’t have to worry anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: not good for 1 1/4" pole
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed sturdy and was holding the pole firmly and straight up.. As I added more sections onto my 12 foot tree, it began to lean. I would not recommend for the 1 1/4" diameter pole-but if you have no other option (as I could not find one), it will hold your tall tree up-just not straight. It seems like it would work for the larger diameter pole.
customer_reviews.author: Ms NJ

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted a fake tree but they couldn't find the stand. Purchased this one and it fit perfectly. It was exactly what I needed. No need to assemble, just slide it to the side to open. That's it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: This tree stand is just what we need for our wonderful 40 year old artificial tree. Tree is in great shape, but the stand has died. So happy to have a new perfect stand.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand, durable
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah! I just don't know why you spend a lot of money on an artificial christmas tree and then you get a crappy stand. This one makes my tree much more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Great If Right Size
customer_reviews.text: Nice stand but wrong size pole opening for the tree. Thought the adjustment screw would hold on place but no luck. Had to purchase a different, less expensive plastic stand similar to the original that broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jax Sage

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Tree Stand
customer_reviews.text: This tree stand saved us from needing to by a new Christmas tree just before Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Eberth, SCPO, USCG, Ret

customer_reviews.title: NEEDS 1/4 INCH LONGER TIGHTING SCREW TO HOLD TREE IN TUBE
customer_reviews.text: VERY SMALL TIGHTNING SCREW ON SIDE OF HOLDER NEEDS TO BE AT LEAST 1/4 INCH LONGER. I ALMOST SENT IT BACK, BUT LONG TUBE HOLDER OF BOTTOM OF TREE HOLDS IT IN. THIS TREE HOLDER IS A BEAUTIFUL DESIGN AND SIZE, AND BEAUTIFULLY ENGINEERED TO FOLD INTO ITSELF, BUT ENGINEERS COULD HAVE GIVEN LONGER SCREW LENGTH
customer_reviews.author: JOHN BLACKLEY 83 YEAR OLD

customer_reviews.title: I like this tree stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tree stand. It holds my 7.5ft artificial tree very well. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Product not as advertised. Does not hold 7.5 tree. The tree slide through the bottom and it’s not sturdy enough to hold the tree standing
customer_reviews.author: Rnmommy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as requested. Easy to use; just drop the tree into the unit and tighten the screw.... Legs are broad and make the tree very sturdy, but takes a lot of floor space...... good product for good price....
customer_reviews.author: LLM

customer_reviews.title: My 1st Amazon Return
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say that this did not work for my Christmas Tree and that I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Christine

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than the stand it replaced
customer_reviews.text: I don't love this design because the welds will snap with enough force. My original stand uses smaller diameter parts and snapped when the tree fell during moving. This one is much sturdier. Less tree wabble too.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee addict

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This tree stand was perfect. I was gifted a 9ft Christmas tree but it did not have a stand. I found this on Amazon and it's the only ons that was sturdy enough for our large tree.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget and family

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had lost my artificle tree stand during a move. I looked at all my local stores, and was unsuccesful. I purchased this stand hoping it would work, and it did like a charm. It's easy to use. It simply folds out and in. It's very sturdy. My tree is a pretty full 7' tree, and this stand surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Audie Shank

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made. Holds our 7 footer, no problem. Durability will be proven over time, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a 1 1/4" diameter tree
customer_reviews.text: It's too small for a tree that has a standard 1 1/4 inch pipe. I tried banging it in with a hammer but no luck. Bad description.
customer_reviews.author: havocado

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just what we were looking for to replace a old tree stand.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: The 16" supports my 6 foot tall, 1.5 diameter tree perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 16 inch for a 6 foot tall tree, that lost its support years ago and at first I was concerned because of negative reviews. The support arrived and it fits perfectly and supports the tree with no issues. I just put up the tree and I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P.

customer_reviews.title: so pleased !!
customer_reviews.text: the other christmas tree stand we had was falling apart and we thought we were going to have to throw the tree out but this stand saved our lives just make sure when u order to get the size of stand u will need according to the size of your tree ours was 7 feet tall so we got this bigger stand and it works perfectly the other stand as it god older andmore rickety would takes hours just to get the stand up this one literally took less than a minute couldn't be more pleased. What a time saver !
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bogenschutz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12ft H x 5ft W tree so I was on the very end of height requirement. I was worried that it wouldn't be strong enough however it works great. It is built well and and heavy to support a large tree.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I needed it for. Stable and easy to use and not that big.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Good quality. Used with a 6 ft tree
customer_reviews.author: Annmarie porter

customer_reviews.title: OK stand - replace screw for a stronger one.
customer_reviews.text: I like the stand the nut to tighten up is cheap and needs to be stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Buyno

customer_reviews.title: This had to have been used
customer_reviews.text: It looked used. The box was taped over as if it had been opened. The screw is too short to go through the pole and it's a bit wobbly. My tree stands but it leans.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great item purchased
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the versatile option of the flexibility and easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelv

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My current stand broke and this one worked perfect for my 7.5 ft tree.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Saved me hundreds of dollars
customer_reviews.text: This stand arrived and saved me from having to buy a new Christmas tree! We recently moved and lost the stand to our 9 ft Christmas tree...I turned the house inside out looking but no success...I never though I’d find one on amazon that fit a 2 inch pole...but I looked and there it was. Arrived in 3 days....PERFECT FIT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong & stable.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a large artificial Christmas tree then this is the stand for you.
customer_reviews.author: L. Holbert

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice. All one has to do is separate and twist the screw to tighten and that's all.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Had been given a Christmas tree but had no stand. This worked perfectly and was easy to use and will store nicely when the holiday season is over as it collapses together. It is holding up an 8 foot tree with no concern of it falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Yee

customer_reviews.title: Worked great fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Lost my original this went right back were original worked great
customer_reviews.author: D. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Be sure of the size needed.
customer_reviews.text: Although the stand came with 2 different sizers, it did not fit my tree. The piece that sits in the bottom to stabilize it kept moving around so the tree wouldn’t stay straight. My husband drilled out a portion of the sizer and it fit better. Not a bad product just needed something that fit better.
customer_reviews.author: C. Priebe

customer_reviews.title: Get the correct size for your tree
customer_reviews.text: This is the correct size for our tree. I never knew that would make such a difference.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN H. ECKSTEIN

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this...
customer_reviews.text: My tree would not stand up straight. Perhaps if it had more than one screw to hold the tree. Also it seemed small. I would say if your tree is over 5 feet instead of the 6ft go up to the next size.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Very well made. Folds flat for storage.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 foot tree with a 1.5 inch diameter pole. This base accommodates up to 2 inch diameter poles. With the adjustment screw it was a good fit. Padded feet. Tried a cheaper product first that I had to send back. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rg1

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the photo - Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The Stand has only one screw to tighten the tree pole into the base and the screw that came with it only went into the tube about 1/16 inch so really no tightening at all. Because of this the stand is useless.The photo shows three screws, so you will not get the same item as is shown. The base of the tree cannot be tightened and will not stay in the stand. VERY disappointing. Will now need to it send back. A big waste of time. YOU NEED TO UPDATE THE PHOTOS WHEN THE PRODUCT CHANGES
customer_reviews.author: Todd A

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought another tree stand that should have worked for our artificial tree. Unfortunately, the hold holding the tree up was not deep enough so I chose this stand to replace it. IT IS PERFECT and was very sturdy and easy to use! It should last for many years to come. I must also say I found the Amazon return for the other stand to be one of the easiest returns I have ever done for mail order items. So all in all I am VERY happy with Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jan T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this tree stand! It held my 9.5 ft tree up with no problem. The most stable its ever been! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CaseyC

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I needed! Do not be afraid to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy tree stand for trees that use 1 1/4" poles
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Fits a 1.25-Inch pole perfectly. Folds flat for storage. Once it's opened and the pole is secured with the screws provided, the legs are locked in place and can't be moved until the screws are later loosened. A little expensive for what it is, but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Bill

customer_reviews.title: Me tree is 9 feet
customer_reviews.text: I broke my Christmas tree stand so I had to replace it. This worked perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: Cherry Toone

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It was just what we needed for my grandmothers old Christmas tree.
customer_reviews.author: Janette F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for broken stand
customer_reviews.text: Worked out perfect to replace my mom’s stand. I had tilted the tree and one of the legs broke. This was a perfect replacement and much better than the one that came with her tree. (7 foot tree - very wide base)
customer_reviews.author: Connie Stockton

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to buy this tree stand!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the stand we lost in our last move. This metal stand is 10 times better than the original plastic one that came with the tree! Our tree is huge at 9.5, I truly think its taller, and is very stable in this stand. Exceeded our expectations! Fold flat for storage.
customer_reviews.author: J Salzwimmer

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Used it this Christmas season with a 7 ft artificial tree
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Easy up, durable!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, luckily, because the tree was already decorated, when the old stand broke! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: S V

customer_reviews.title: So goad
customer_reviews.text: So glad I found this didn’t want to have to buy a whole new tree since it still looks really good
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Shore
